elements.title: Customer Factoring
elements.subtitle: (Domestic and Export)
elements.body: This tool allows a company to convert its accounts receivable into immediate cash, which will not only improve its cash flow but also allow it to reinvest in its growth without waiting for its customers to pay.

elements.title: Reverse factoring
elements.body: In these cases, the buyer arranges with a financial institution to pay invoices to its suppliers before they are due. This arrangement is often at a more favorable rate due to the buyer's credit rating. It enables suppliers to receive prompt payment while allowing the buyer to improve business relationships by securing timely payments and potentially negotiating better terms.

elements.title: Import factoring
elements.body: This instrument helps companies that import goods and services to finance their purchases. In these cases, the financial entity pays foreign suppliers on behalf of the importer, improving the importer's negotiating capacity and generating greater cash flow without tying up capital. As a result, the importer can use its resources for other operational needs and can also insure its credit risk vis-à-vis the supplier.

elements.title: Revolving Lines of Credit
elements.body: This tool offers unparalleled flexibility for companies to obtain financing under the cover of their invoices and purchase orders. It allows a company to access funds as needed and pay only for what is used, making it ideal for managing cash flow fluctuations or financing unexpected projects.
